column5: Paul and I exchanged a few PMs this weekend. He has shown himself to be a real class act and I want to appologize publicly for ranting about him...   To everyone that called me a Jerk, a idiot, and a Troll...."Up yers"!   Dax
You're a good man!
Paul is a straight as they come real good guide and a great guy. Good on ya for stepping up
Ya got to be careful about P`oing a guy named Paul Castelano!!!
Your momma raised a real man !  Good on ya
seems to me you are both reel Classy Guys!
Always stirring the pot eh Dax??
glad to hear you guys straightened things out..
thats stand up rite there! good on ya PG!
It takes a man to be wrong, but it takes a bigger one to admit it.
Nicely done...thanks for making OFC a little classier
i guess i missed something...  hehehe good to see whatever it was is over with.
I'm glad you guys worked it out, good on you for making this post.

Hi Guys, Not sure what happened over the weekend but all I can tell you is Paul is a great guy. Glad you worked it out. He is one of the best  guides in the world that's right I said world! He knows the water, the fish and is a super pro with his clients. I have meet many great guides and many not so great guides and I will tell you Paul one of the best in the world. Also a great guy you will leave at the end of the day fishing with Paul with a new friend. Not only a great guide but a great person we need more people like him in our sport he really cares about the future.  Just my thoughts.
I echo Daves statment, Paul's a class act.
Man we is tight....
Good on ya'......sorry, i too just wanted to know what it felt like to say Good on Ya'
I always said" Be the bigger man".  Good on ya for stepping up and admitting failure Dax.  Ya wanna pick on someone, pick on this Dave Mercer guy, who is he anyways?
Might want to take down your original posts as well Dax
now everyone will go back and look for them...LOL

I already did go looking (yesterday) and finding. I guess that's why I didn't comment until now. If Dax's original "claim" was inaccurate, I think there should be more than an apology. Should be a retraction of the statement (ie I was wrong) plus an apology. If the original claim was accurate then no need for apology as far as I'm concerned, even if he is a "nice guy".
Well done. It takes a man of character to admit when he is wrong and apologize for it.  Kudos to you,  G.

I guess this is my point (see above). I don't see any admission of being wrong. I just see "Turns out he's a real good guy and I feel bad that I've said negative things...not going to take any of the statements back, just wish I hadn't said them because now I like him"
